44  public final class HttpCacheHeaderUtil {
45    
46    public static void sendNotModified(HttpServletResponse res) {
47      res.setStatus(HttpServletResponse.SC_NOT_MODIFIED);
48    }
49  
50    public static void sendPreconditionFailed(HttpServletResponse res) {
51      res.setStatus(HttpServletResponse.SC_PRECONDITION_FAILED);
52    }
53    
54    /**
55     * Weak Ref based cache for keeping track of core specific etagSeed
56     * and the last computed etag.
57     *
58     * @see #calcEtag
59     */
60    private static WeakIdentityMap<SolrCore, EtagCacheVal> etagCoreCache = WeakIdentityMap.newConcurrentHashMap();
61  
62    /** @see #etagCoreCache */
63    private static class EtagCacheVal {
64      private final String etagSeed;
65      
66      private String etagCache = null;
67      private long indexVersionCache=-1;
68      
69      public EtagCacheVal(final String etagSeed) {
70        this.etagSeed = etagSeed;
71      }
72  
73      public String calcEtag(final long currentIndexVersion) {
74        if (currentIndexVersion != indexVersionCache) {
75          indexVersionCache=currentIndexVersion;
76          
77          try {
78            etagCache = "\""
79             + new String(Base64.encodeBase64((Long.toHexString
80                                               (Long.reverse(indexVersionCache))
81                                               + etagSeed).getBytes("US-ASCII")), "US-ASCII")
82             + "\"";
83          } catch (UnsupportedEncodingException e) {
84            throw new RuntimeException(e); // may not happen
85          }
86        }
87        
88        return etagCache;
89      }
90    }
91    
92    /**
93     * Calculates a tag for the ETag header.
94     *
95     * @return a tag
96     */
97    public static String calcEtag(final SolrQueryRequest solrReq) {
98      final SolrCore core = solrReq.getCore();
99      final long currentIndexVersion
100       = solrReq.getSearcher().getIndexReader().getVersion();
101 
102     EtagCacheVal etagCache = etagCoreCache.get(core);
103     if (null == etagCache) {
104       final String etagSeed
105         = core.getSolrConfig().getHttpCachingConfig().getEtagSeed();
106       etagCache = new EtagCacheVal(etagSeed);
107       etagCoreCache.put(core, etagCache);
108     }
109     
110     return etagCache.calcEtag(currentIndexVersion);
111     
112   }
113 
114   /**
115    * Checks if one of the tags in the list equals the given etag.
116    * 
117    * @param headerList
118    *            the ETag header related header elements
119    * @param etag
120    *            the ETag to compare with
121    * @return true if the etag is found in one of the header elements - false
122    *         otherwise
123    */
124   public static boolean isMatchingEtag(final List<String> headerList,
125       final String etag) {
126     for (String header : headerList) {
127       final String[] headerEtags = header.split(",");
128       for (String s : headerEtags) {
129         s = s.trim();
130         if (s.equals(etag) || "*".equals(s)) {
131           return true;
132         }
133       }
134     }
135 
136     return false;
137   }
138 
139   /**
140    * Calculate the appropriate last-modified time for Solr relative the current request.
141    * 
142    * @return the timestamp to use as a last modified time.
143    */
144   public static long calcLastModified(final SolrQueryRequest solrReq) {
145     final SolrCore core = solrReq.getCore();
146     final SolrIndexSearcher searcher = solrReq.getSearcher();
147     
148     final LastModFrom lastModFrom
149       = core.getSolrConfig().getHttpCachingConfig().getLastModFrom();
150 
151     long lastMod;
152     try {
153       // assume default, change if needed (getOpenTime() should be fast)
154       lastMod =
155         LastModFrom.DIRLASTMOD == lastModFrom
156         ? IndexDeletionPolicyWrapper.getCommitTimestamp(searcher.getIndexReader().getIndexCommit())
157         : searcher.getOpenTimeStamp().getTime();
158     } catch (IOException e) {
159       // we're pretty freaking screwed if this happens
160       throw new SolrException(ErrorCode.SERVER_ERROR, e);
161     }
162     // Get the time where the searcher has been opened
163     // We get rid of the milliseconds because the HTTP header has only
164     // second granularity
165     return lastMod - (lastMod % 1000L);
166   }
167 
168   @SuppressForbidden(reason = "Need currentTimeMillis to send out cache control headers externally")
169   private static long timeNowForHeader() {
170     return System.currentTimeMillis();
171   }
172 
173   /**
174    * Set the Cache-Control HTTP header (and Expires if needed)
175    * based on the SolrConfig.
176    * @param conf The config of the SolrCore handling this request
177    * @param resp The servlet response object to modify
178    * @param method The request method (GET, POST, ...) used by this request
179    */
180   public static void setCacheControlHeader(final SolrConfig conf,
181                                            final HttpServletResponse resp, final Method method) {
182     // We do not emit HTTP header for POST and OTHER request types
183     if (Method.POST==method || Method.OTHER==method) {
184       return;
185     }
186     final String cc = conf.getHttpCachingConfig().getCacheControlHeader();
187     if (null != cc) {
188       resp.setHeader("Cache-Control", cc);
189     }
190     Long maxAge = conf.getHttpCachingConfig().getMaxAge();
191     if (null != maxAge) {
192       resp.setDateHeader("Expires", timeNowForHeader() + (maxAge * 1000L));
193     }
194 
195     return;
196   }
197 
198   /**
199    * Sets HTTP Response cache validator headers appropriately and
200    * validates the HTTP Request against these using any conditional
201    * request headers.
202    *
203    * If the request contains conditional headers, and those headers
204    * indicate a match with the current known state of the system, this
205    * method will return "true" indicating that a 304 Status code can be
206    * returned, and no further processing is needed.
207    *
208    * 
209    * @return true if the request contains conditional headers, and those
210    *         headers indicate a match with the current known state of the
211    *         system -- indicating that a 304 Status code can be returned to
212    *         the client, and no further request processing is needed.  
213    */
214   public static boolean doCacheHeaderValidation(final SolrQueryRequest solrReq,
215                                                 final HttpServletRequest req,
216                                                 final Method reqMethod,
217                                                 final HttpServletResponse resp) {
218     
219     if (Method.POST==reqMethod || Method.OTHER==reqMethod) {
220       return false;
221     }
222     
223     final long lastMod = HttpCacheHeaderUtil.calcLastModified(solrReq);
224     final String etag = HttpCacheHeaderUtil.calcEtag(solrReq);
225     
226     resp.setDateHeader("Last-Modified", lastMod);
227     resp.setHeader("ETag", etag);
228 
229     if (checkETagValidators(req, resp, reqMethod, etag)) {
230       return true;
231     }
232 
233     if (checkLastModValidators(req, resp, lastMod)) {
234       return true;
235     }
236 
237     return false;
238   }
239   
240 
241   /**
242    * Check for etag related conditional headers and set status 
243    * 
244    * @return true if no request processing is necessary and HTTP response status has been set, false otherwise.
245    */
246   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
247   public static boolean checkETagValidators(final HttpServletRequest req,
248                                             final HttpServletResponse resp,
249                                             final Method reqMethod,
250                                             final String etag) {
251     
252     // First check If-None-Match because this is the common used header
253     // element by HTTP clients
254     final List<String> ifNoneMatchList = Collections.list(req
255         .getHeaders("If-None-Match"));
256     if (ifNoneMatchList.size() > 0 && isMatchingEtag(ifNoneMatchList, etag)) {
257       if (reqMethod == Method.GET || reqMethod == Method.HEAD) {
258         sendNotModified(resp);
259       } else {
260         sendPreconditionFailed(resp);
261       }
262       return true;
263     }
264 
265     // Check for If-Match headers
266     final List<String> ifMatchList = Collections.list(req
267         .getHeaders("If-Match"));
268     if (ifMatchList.size() > 0 && !isMatchingEtag(ifMatchList, etag)) {
269       sendPreconditionFailed(resp);
270       return true;
271     }
272 
273     return false;
274   }
275 
276   /**
277    * Check for modify time related conditional headers and set status 
278    * 
279    * @return true if no request processing is necessary and HTTP response status has been set, false otherwise.
280    */
281   public static boolean checkLastModValidators(final HttpServletRequest req,
282                                                final HttpServletResponse resp,
283                                                final long lastMod) {
284 
285     try {
286       // First check for If-Modified-Since because this is the common
287       // used header by HTTP clients
288       final long modifiedSince = req.getDateHeader("If-Modified-Since");
289       if (modifiedSince != -1L && lastMod <= modifiedSince) {
290         // Send a "not-modified"
291         sendNotModified(resp);
292         return true;
293       }
294       
295       final long unmodifiedSince = req.getDateHeader("If-Unmodified-Since");
296       if (unmodifiedSince != -1L && lastMod > unmodifiedSince) {
297         // Send a "precondition failed"
298         sendPreconditionFailed(resp);
299         return true;
300       }
301     } catch (IllegalArgumentException iae) {
302       // one of our date headers was not formated properly, ignore it
303       /* NOOP */
304     }
305     return false;
306   }
307 
308    /**
309    * Checks if the downstream request handler wants to avoid HTTP caching of
310    * the response.
311    * 
312    * @param solrRsp The Solr response object
313    * @param resp The HTTP servlet response object
314    * @param reqMethod The HTTP request type
315    */
316   public static void checkHttpCachingVeto(final SolrQueryResponse solrRsp,
317       HttpServletResponse resp, final Method reqMethod) {
318     // For POST we do nothing. They never get cached
319     if (Method.POST == reqMethod || Method.OTHER == reqMethod) {
320       return;
321     }
322     // If the request handler has not vetoed and there is no
323     // exception silently return
324     if (solrRsp.isHttpCaching() && solrRsp.getException() == null) {
325       return;
326     }
327     
328     // Otherwise we tell the caches that we don't want to cache the response
329     resp.setHeader("Cache-Control", "no-cache, no-store");
330 
331     // For HTTP/1.0 proxy caches
332     resp.setHeader("Pragma", "no-cache");
333 
334     // This sets the expiry date to a date in the past
335     // As long as no time machines get invented this is safe
336     resp.setHeader("Expires", "Sat, 01 Jan 2000 01:00:00 GMT");
337 
338     long timeNowForHeader = timeNowForHeader();
339     // We signal "just modified" just in case some broken
340     // proxy cache does not follow the above headers
341     resp.setDateHeader("Last-Modified", timeNowForHeader);
342     
343     // We override the ETag with something different
344     resp.setHeader("ETag", '"'+Long.toHexString(timeNowForHeader)+'"');
345   }
